text:
Park Jimin whistles along softly to the sound of the chirping birds outside as he pours hot water from his old black kettle into his dented tin cup for his morning drink of tea leaves and honey. Turning his head, he glances out his little cabin window, admiring the morning sunlight streaming through, casting a pretty sight of light through the mild darkness of his little world.

He gathers his shears and his gloves and stuffs them into his little brown basket, getting ready for his usual morning trek through the hillside to gather herbs for his medicine and potions. The town doctor has sent over a request; he is low on his supply of licorice roots and ginseng, ingredients he can use to make a drink to calm tummy ailments.

Jimin drinks his tea and rinses his cup away before he pulls his shaggy, old cape made of bear fur off the wall peg. He shakes it a few times to rid of anything that may have nested in it overnight before wrapping it around his shoulders and tying the string around his neck.

He steps out his front door and breathes in the clean, crisp air, the cold breeze teasing the bridge of his nose until it’s red. He leaves his home area and traipses down a familiar path into the forest, made from frequent walks and missions, eager to greet the only other family member he knows.

"Good morning, Grams," he says softly as he finally passes by the big oak tree where his beloved grandmother is buried, a huge stone marking her place of sleep. He'd put her there himself after she'd died 6 months ago. She too, had been a healer, and the only parent he'd ever known.

Jimin remembers being a young omega, always questioning why they didn't live amongst the villagers of their pack, why they only visited the town occasionally. It isn't until he is older that he learns why he is ostracized from their own pack.

Jimin had found out that it is because he is a scentless omega. Omegas born with his condition live a sad life, their life longevity shorter than normal omegas as well as the fact that they will be mateless for life, having no scent as well as no heat, nothing to assist with attracting others or childbearing. That’s two strikes already against him - scentless and mateless. Scenting is important amongst wolves and to be an outsider puts him in the saddest position. However, he’s learned not to dwell on what if’s and what could be’s and just live out whatever lifetime he is given.

Their pack had feared it to be a contagious condition and though Jimin's grandmother knows otherwise, she still takes him away, if only to protect him from the snide remarks, the bullying and the harassment her grandson would have to deal with.

Now, 23, Jimin lives alone in the same cabin, far from town, with nothing but the wilderness and nature around him; his friends the birds that chirp him awake each morning, the squirrels that visit the nut trees in his front yard, the deers that venture forth shyly to drink from his water well.

He's taken over his grandmother's skill in making his living by making herbal concoctions and selling it to the village physician or gathering fruits and nuts and selling them to the peddlers at the markets. Some days are good, most days are bad. But he doesn't complain, he knows life could always be worst.

Today starts off as any other day and Jimin blows a kiss softly towards his grandmother's site as he continues trudging along. He will stop to talk to her on his way back home, as per his custom since her burial there.

The gentle wind rustles Jimin's blonde tresses and his silvery gray eyes crinkle in a smile as he spots a tiny little blue bird flitter around him. It's the same one, the one he's christened Gyuri. Gyuri had appeared two weeks ago and had accompanied him a certain ways along his morning journeys and Jimin, who thinks the color blue brings good luck, loves seeing her.

"Why hello Gyuri. Good of you to accompany me again today!" he cheerfully calls out and watches as the bird perform a few acrobatic flips in the air as if in understanding. Jimin giggles softly and he slowly spins, following as the bird circles around him.

The smile on his face freezes and then he gasps as his eyes land on a dark, furry lump beyond the snow-covered hill's slight slope. If it's a bear, Jimin is pretty much dead.

Jimin stands still, hoping to not make a noise should it be the animal. After a minute of no movement, Jimin shifts slightly to his left and a spark of light next to the dark, unmoving lump hits his eyes.

Ok...not a bear then. Bears do not stay still that long.

Unable to help himself, Jimin tries to appease his curiosity by scooting forward a few steps. A strong sense of foreboding invade his senses, but he just tells himself to be brave and continues shuffling forward, slowly, quietly.

He gasps softly when he is close enough to see that it is no animal, but another human, covered in a cape of dark fur, his dark brown head of hair ruffling in the wind's breeze.

No longer worrying about his own self, Jimin's healer instincts kick in and he rushes forth to see if he can be of any help.

A faint scent of alpha masculinity and virility hits Jimin as he falls to his knees beside the body and flips the heavy male over unto his back. He feels for a pulse and breathes an audible sigh of relief when he presses his fingers against the cold neck and feels the slight drumming against his fingertips.

Jimin's eyes do a quick inventory, knowing by the garments that this is no ordinary alpha, he is some kind of a warrior, if the bow and arrows on his back and the heavy sword glinting up at him is any indication. The fur cape and vest he is wearing can feed Jimin for a whole year, and his boots are made of heavy, sturdy leather, a luxury Jimin has only ever seen in the cobbler's windows.

There is blood on the alpha's temple and Jimin knows that that wound is what caused the warrior to fade out. He pushes back the alpha's dark bangs and blots at the wound with a strip of cloth he'd pulled from his basket. This man needs to get out of the cold if he is to survive and Jimin is not physically strong enough to get him back to his cabin by himself.

--

Jeon Jungkook stirs and tries to move out of the beam of sunlight directly hitting his closed eyelids. There is a thorough pounding in his temple that will not cease, but he also hears a soft, angelic voice singing from far away...

Jungkook's eyes snap open and he sits up with a gasp as his mind recalls the events he last remembered taking place. He automatically reaches out for the sword at his side.

"Hey! Woah! You're safe! You're ok...you're in my home..."

The angelic voice halts Jungkook and he freezes as his vision adjusts to the dimness of the cabin he is in. His feet are warm and he notices that he is laid out by a wood fire, his boots gone, feet directed to the flames. He's covered in his fur jacket plus another old, worn-down fur cape.

A presence settles down beside him and Jungkook looks over to see pretty silver eyes, blonde hair and cherubic cheeks. Jungkook sniffs. Nothing.

"I'm Park Jimin, a healer. You're in my cabin, there's no danger for you here."

"I...I can't smell you. Why?"

"Oh...I'm...well, I'm scentless."

Jungkook's eyes widen. A scentless omega. He's heard of them, but never seen one before.

"My sword..."

"It's over there with your bow and arrows," Jimin points to the wall behind him and Jungkook sees his father's prized sword along with his own weapons leaning against the wall.

"How long have I been unconscious?"

"I found you 2 days ago...I don't know how long you were out before then, but your wound was pretty fresh so I'd say you were lucky I found you when I did. Otherwise the bears would've ate you for their lunch."

Jungkook isn't sure if that was an attempt at humor or not, it had been said in a pretty deadpanned tone.

"I...umm...I need to use the outdoors."

"Ok, let me help you up, you've been laid up a bit too long."

Jungkook watches as the young, small omega gets up and reaches his hand out expectantly. Jungkook, not knowing what else to do, takes the help, allowing Jimin to grasp his upper arm in a supporting manner.

When they get to the doorway, he removes his arm from the smaller's shoulders and hobbles slowly down the stairs into the direction of the shrubs in the back where Jimin points him to.

The morning is fresh and dewy, a cold chill in the air. He takes care of his business and then stretches, really feeling his strength returning. He touches the cloth patch covering his right temple and then pats himself down, trying to feel for any other damage, sighing in relief when he is met only with soreness.

He owes the omega a debt of gratitude.

When he ambles back into the front of the cabin, he sees Jimin's small form by his stack of firewood against the opposite cabin wall. He stares for a bit, half of it out of curiosity, the other half in admiration of the omega's beauty. He has nothing to worry about, knowing that scentless omegas are a threat to no one, having no personal scent to attract alphas and betas and having no heats that need to be taken care of.

He's just never been told they would be so beautiful.

--

Jimin bends down and picks up a few of the smaller logs into his arms.

During his patient's unconscious state, Jimin had thought he was a ridiculously handsome alpha, but to see him awake in the daylight had struck him speechless. He really is quite a beautiful male, dark hair, big, intense eyes, tall, dominating height, sinewy muscles everywhere.

Jimin doesn't need to be a regular omega to appreciate good looks. Based on looks alone, he thinks Jungkook's mate is pretty lucky, indeed.

As he reaches for one more piece of wood, an encroaching shadow stops him and he looks up to find his patient next to him.

"Here, let me help you."

Jimin hears him grunt out softly before he's transferred the ones in his arms into his own and picked up the last piece Jimin had been aiming for.

"What's your name?" Jimin follows along as the alpha turns back towards the cabin.

"Jeon Jungkook from the Jeon Pack in the north."

"Ohhh..." Jimin breathes out softly. He's heard all about the Jeon Pack. They're a very, if not the most, powerful of the Wolf packs in their region, high in numbers with very skilled warriors.

"Can I...can I ask what happened to you out there?"

"Basically, I was being too careless."

As they climb the front steps, Jimin almost stumbles into Jungkook's broad back when he abruptly stops. Following his gaze, Jimin sees that he's spotted the makeshift stretcher of logs tied together with ropes propped by the bushes. Jimin steps back as he turns around.

“I’m guessing that’s how you got me back here?”

“Yes. You’re a heavy wolf. I had to pull you onto it and then drag you that whole mile home.”

Jungkook grunts out an awkward thank you to which Jimin just smiles at him.

They enter the cabin and Jimin walks over to push open the furs lining the other windows so more light can enter the dimness.

"I have two other friends here; we came for the fur trading and they're probably going crazy trying to find me right now. While they were resting up from our trip here, I ventured out and became the victim of a robbery. I knew better but I was-" Jungkook hesitates, and, deciding not to divulge too much, lays the wood down on the floor next to the small fire pit of dying embers.

"Anyway, I'm going to have to return soon, my friends are probably tearing the town apart trying to find me."

Jimin settles down on his cot against the wall. "I'm sure they're worried. It must be nice to have friends. Especially close ones who would look for you."

Jungkook sits back down on the makeshift bed he'd awoken in on the opposite side and looks at Jimin.

"You...don't have friends in your pack?"

"I..." Jimin bites his lip. "I don't have a pack so I wouldn't have any friends. I have the animals that aren't afraid to venture out into my yard." he finishes with a small smile.

Jungkook's eyes widen. "No pack? No protection? How did you survive this long?"

"Well...I had my grandmother up until 6 months ago...But she passed away and I'm learning to fend for myself."

Jungkook's mind is aghast. An omega fending for himself? In the wild? He can't think of how lucky Jimin has been...in these same woods, before he'd been attacked, he’d wondered upon a few poachers and bears in neighboring areas. Jungkook can't explain this sense of overwhelming protectiveness, but as he stares at the small form across from him, he can't fathom Jimin being all alone and getting hurt.

"Jimin. Why don't you have a pack? This is Yang territory, aren't you a part of theirs?"

"I was. Not anymore. I'm scentless."

Jungkook waits with a cocked brow, unsure why that matters.

Jimin sighs.

"People don't like different around here. They feel that I may be contagious-"

"That’s stupid. Even with me not knowing much about the condition, I'm well aware that being scentless is not some sort of a disease."

Jimin feels his eyes well up at the easy acceptance from someone, a stranger, no less.

"Thank you for saying that," he murmurs softly, lowering his eyes.

"I'm not sorry to say...your old pack is really stupid."

Jimin giggles softly. "It's ok. I've learned to adapt by myself."

Jungkook is about to say something when he picks up a different scent.

"Shh!" he hushes Jimin with one finger to his lips before moving to the open window overlooking the front of Jimin's open lawn.

He waits. He knows who it is, but he needs to be completely sure, not wanting to jeopardize Jimin's safety.

Horse and rider break through the barrier of trees and Jungkook breathes out a sigh of relief upon espying his friend Yoongi's white head of hair.

"I can smell you, young buck. Get your fuckin' ass out here, we've been worried sick!"

Jungkook grins at the deep husky voice and turns to a wide-eyed Jimin.

"He's one of the friends I told you about. He's harmless to omegas."

--

Jungkook takes off out the front door and into Yoongi's waiting embrace. They clap one another's backs before Yoongi starts to inquire about what happened, only to stop and stare at the front door of the cabin.

"Who is that? I didn't smell any other presence...?"

"That's my savior. Park Jimin. He's a scentless omega."

"Wow. Wait...so thats not your mate? I thought the seer said your mate was in this area?"

"He must've been wrong. And no, not my mate, scentless omegas can't mate, remember?"

"Hmm. Damn shame. This one’s gorgeous."

Jungkook doesn't know why but he's a little annoyed at the comment. "Where's NamJoon?"

"We didn't know what had happened to you so Joon went back up North to report that you'd gone missing."

"Aish, Yoongi. Seriously?!"

"It's ok. We'll catch up to him if we leave now."

Jungkook nods.

"Come, let's go say farewell to Jimin and get my weapons."

--

Jimin watches from his doorway as Jungkook hops up onto the horseback behind his friend Yoongi.

He'd packed a few pieces of bread and cheese for the alphas and wished them a safe journey back home.

As they disappear into the looming forest and he turns into his cabin again, he feels the emptiness hit him hard, a void he'd never felt until now.

Even though Jungkook had been unconscious most of his time here, Jimin had started to take to having another presence in his tiny cabin. It was nice to just walk around doing his chores and talk and pretend that the other person could hear him and his questions. And now, it is over.

Time to set his life back into it's normal, boring, quiet, everyday routine.

--

Jungkook closes the flap on his bag and settles down on the rented hostel cot, trying to figure out the reason for his unease.

It's been thirty minutes since he and Yoongi have arrived back to their little room in the village and he's been all forms of restless, prowling around the interior, almost growling.

"Yah."

He freezes in his spot and turns to Yoongi, realizing he’d been pacing again.

"What's wrong? You've been a mess since we returned...?"

Jungkook looks at his best friend, unsure of what to say. He kind of knows why he is in this mood, but he’s not entirely sure what he can do about it...yet he can’t just...

Jungkook stops pacing, suddenly realizing that he needs to at least ask.

"Hyung, I'll be back. Give me an hour." Jungkook picks up the bow and arrow set he had just laid out to clean.

"What-yah!"

Yoongi yells out, watching with wide eyes as Jungkook sprints out the door and hops onto the horse, headed back out in the direction they had just come from.

"This kid." he says to himself fondly.

--

Jimin closes his eyes, fear etched across his features, willing himself not to move as the huge black bear wanders up to his front door.

He can't believe this is happening. After all his life of living in this cabin, a bear would now wander into his yard. A big, hungry bear.

Bears this size are strong and he knows his cabin door won't stand much of a chance if the bear charges at it. Jimin gives a little prayer that it would just move on and away if it doesn't sense any movement.

At that thought, he hears broken glass and knows the bear has just broken a small window with his huge paws.

Clenching his eyes shut again, Jimin offers another small prayer, this time for help.

He's frozen, scared shitless, wondering what to do when he hears the bear suddenly howl loudly before a loud vibrating thud thumps against his front door. His fear is coming true, the bear is charging.

Jimin turns and presses his hands up against his door with all his might, a weak sob breaking out, knowing it won't hold, wondering how he is going to survive-

"Jimin!"

Jimin's eyes snap open.

Jungkook?

"Jimin, are you ok? Open up!"

Scrambling now to lift up the heavy bar across his door, Jimin pushes it away with a desperate sob before tearing the door open.

He gasps as he sees the huge bear, dead on its side, blocking his doorway, 4 poison arrows sticking out of its body.

Jimin looks up as a shadow falls over him and he breathes out the biggest sigh of relief upon seeing a familiar face.

"Jungkook!"

Jimin backs up as Jungkook hops over the dead animal and into his cabin before his trembling legs give out and he collapses into the other's arms, unable to stop his tears.

"You're ok, shhh."

"I...I was sso...so scared!"

Jimin feels his big hands pat his back softly until his shaking dissipates. He follows as Jungkook backs away and pulls him further into the room to sit him on the cot before lowering down to his hunches, gripping Jimin's small hand in his.

"Jimin."

Jimin wipes his tears and peers at Jungkook's handsome face.

"I'm leaving to go back to my pack in a bit."

Jimin nods. He already knows this, Jungkook and Yoongi had mentioned it earlier. He wonders why Jungkook is bringing this up again.

"Jimin...come with me. With us."

Jimin's mouth falls open, not sure he had heard correctly.

“Wh...What?”

"You said so yourself, you have no pack here, no family left, nothing. If you come with me, my pack will welcome you with open arms. We don't turn away innocent, packless wolves and there is always a need for healers."

"Jungkook..." Jimin breathes out, in awe at his generosity.

"I'm...I'm a scentless omega. No one will accept me wherever I go. I'm destined to be alone-"

"Stop. You are not. This train of thought from your idiotic old pack has poisoned your mind. Scentless, yes, but still an omega, one who deserves protection and respect from a pack."

Jimin can't even begin to hope. "You don't know for sure your pack will accept me. Your pack leader could even punish you and disown you for daring to bring forth an outsider!"

Jungkook breaks out into a grin, the first Jimin has seen from him. And oh, does he look handsome. His face turns youthful and cute, his eyes and nose crinkle, the smile is toothy and darling.

But Jimin still doesn't find the situation funny.

“Don’t laugh, I’m serious here.” He pouts.

"My father won't ever disown me, Jimin."

Jimin's brows wrinkle in confusion...Father? Oh. Oh!

"You...you're the son of the Jeon Pack's Chief?"

"The one and only. So you see, you will have no issues joining our pack. I promise."

Too good. Too good to be true. Can Jimin leave behind his cabin? What about his grandmother? This is where he grew up...where he lives...with no one to care and no one to care for him. Maybe...just maybe his grandmother would understand.

Jimin looks into the eyes of the alpha in front of him. He stares hard, trying to find any hint of humor or playfulness or even just plain awful lying. He sees nothing but genuine concern and that seals his fate.

"O...okay, Jungkook. I'll come with you. If you're sure-"

"I'm sure. My pack will welcome you."

"I need to say good-bye to someone...may we make a stop before we head out?"

--

The three of them had managed to catch up to Kim Namjoon, as Yoongi had predicted, by the end of their first day of traveling. Just a couple more days and they would be in Jeon territory.

Jimin is both excited and nervous, having never belonged to a pack and scared of how they would react to his condition. However, he takes both Yoongi and Joon's reaction when they’d learned of it to be a good indication. Joon had been impressed and intrigued, asked a few questions and offered him food before promptly starting in on stories of their pack and their village.

Tonight, as they sit around the fire and enjoy their dinner of roasted rabbit and grilled turnips, he learns that Yoongi is sweet on an omega named Hoseok and Joon is mated to a female beta named SoJung.

"Jiminie, I'm so damn happy you came along. We’ve never eaten so good on travels."

Jimin smiles at the compliment from Joon, his cheeks pinkening. He isn't a warrior and the boys hadn't needed any medical attention so he had offered his cooking services so as to somehow not feel so inadequate and since learning of his talent, the boys had constantly killed fresh meat for him to prepare.

After their supper, Jungkook takes the first watch, allowing Joon and Yoongi to catch up on some shut-eye.

As Jimin cleans and wipes the pan he'd used to cook the turnips, Jungkook polishes his sword by the fire. Jimin sneaks a glance at him, admiring the way the firelight illuminates depths and shadows on his handsome face Jungkook is striking in a purely masculine way, virility and masculinity painting his tall form and muscular body, yet hints of boyish handsomeness traces his facial features with big, dark, doe eyes, a cute nose and a smile that is more youthful than manly.

Jimin finds himself in another moment where he wishes he isn't mateless. Jimin doesn't like to dwell on things he can't have, but once in a while, yearnings like this hit and he has little power to stop it.

Sure, he doesn't have all the primitive, baser desires, but he still would like to have someone to hold and comfort and have the favor returned.

Gathering his courage, Jimin pointedly asks, "Jungkook-ah, do you have a mate waiting for you back home too?"

"No. Haven't found my omega yet." Jungkook doesn't stop polishing his sword nor does he look up as he answers.

"Oh."

The chirping of night crickets and the snapping of the fire is all that can be heard for a moment as Jimin reflects on that tidbit. He can’t help wondering if the Jeon Pack betas and omegas line up for Jungkook to choose.

"Before embarking on this mission, a seer passed by our village. He's been around our neighboring villages for ages and visits my parents every so often. You’ll meet him someday. He'd predicted that during this journey, chances are high that I will meet my mate along the way. So far, his predictions have been false and seeing how we only have two more days before we reach home, I don't see any of it coming true."

Jimin presses his lips together, feeling for the young warrior. His heart goes soft and he gives a tiny smile. The alpha may be a big, strong warrior, but inside, he is a romantic at heart - he’s looking for that one single, special connection that wolves long for when choosing a mate. As a scentless, his grandmother never really talked about this stuff with him, but he still remembers sneaking behind her back every chance he gets when she’s with clients and other old villagers, listening in on their talks and gossips about true mate bonds and wolves who even die from broken hearts.

Jimin hopes for Jungkook. He’s a kind person who would cater to his mate’s every need. And at least he knows he has a mate out there. For Jimin, there's not even a hope.

"He did give me a warning as well,” Jungkook continues, prompting Jimin to look up from his musings. “That my mate, when I do meet them, will come upon some sort of situation that will require my assistance, a life or death one."

Jimin gasps.

"That's...kind of scary!"

Jimin feels himself fall a little bit deeper into the sparkly abyss of Jeon Jungkook's eyes as he finally looks up at him and a small smile turns his lips at the astonished expression on Jimin's face.

“Jungkook-ah, I really hope you find them. As I am a healer, whatever you can't do, I promise to help you and your mate."

Jungkook chuckles softly at the sweet declaration. He is endeared by this passionate omega. He can kind of see now how Jimin has survived so long being packless. He has a positive spirit that is quite infectious. Both Yoongi and Joon have already taken a liking to him, not to mention himself, and they've only known each other a matter of days.

"Go to sleep, omega. We got a long day tomorrow."

--

One more day.

Jimin is excited. Tomorrow by noon they will be with the Jeon pack.

Gathering the two pans he'd used to make their noon lunch of grilled fish and roots, he makes his way down to the little riverbed they'd passed.

He makes sure to wave at Yoongi on his way away from their campsite, as requested by Jungkook whenever one of them needed to venture off.

He sits down at the bank of the river and stares out into the water, taking a moment just to get lost in the calming ripples.

He feels a bit guilty for leaving behind his home, his grandmother, but at the same time, he feels that this is what he needs to do. Though his condition warrants so, Jimin can't help feeling that he's just not a person built for solitude. He craves conversation, laughter, tenderness, affection. He's eager to be surrounded by children and their innocence, friendly faces and kind neighbors. He tries not to put high hopes on getting all of this with the Jeon Pack, but neither can he help his anticipatory nature.

He'd grown up to understand his grandmother's protective nature and he's thankful, but at the same time, he feels he's missed out so much on not having a pack, including all the negatives.

With one last sigh, Jimin stands back up and bends down to pick up the pans. He needs to wash them and head back so they can start their journey onwards.

--

Jungkook returns to the site with two freshly killed rabbits in his hands, ready for their dinner tonight.

He tosses them into the leather bag hanging off his horse's saddle before turning to Joon, busy brushing his animal's rump.

"Where's Jimin?"

"I don't know." He turns to Yoongi, coming up from packing their tents.

"Yoongi, where's Jimin?"

"He went down to the river to rinse out the pans about 10 minutes ago."

Jungkook's brows furrow and he feels a slight tickle at the back of his neck. He's probably overthinking, but he's not one to ignore his senses. Tongue in cheek and with a slight cock of his neck, he turns and heads towards the river bank.

Jungkook's heartbeat trips when he sees no Jimin in sight. It escalates when he spots the two dented pans lying haphazardly on the hillside.

Shit.

He runs back to the other two. He'd known those were carriage wheel tracks he'd spotted earlier.

--

Jimin wipes away the tears streaming down his cheek and huddles into the corner of the dark wooden carriage as it traverses over the bumps and holes of the dirt road.

He doesn't know if the alphas will realize he's gone in time, if they'd even be able to find him...

Jimin had just been on his way back up the hill when he'd been grabbed from behind by 4 men, all hunters from their garb, and hauled over and thrown into this creaky wooden cart.

He'd heard them mutter about getting a good price for an omega and Jimin just knew...they were going to sell him as a slave.

He was so close...soooo close to belonging in a pack...maybe fitting in and finding a sense of belonging, maybe even some real friends...

He should have known his curse as a scentless omega wouldn't let him.

Jimin sniffles again and curls into a ball, the image of Jungkook's face flashing before his mind. His one real, true friend, snatched from him in the blink of an eye. Jimin brushes at the tears that continue to fall, wondering why life is always so unfair to him.

All of a sudden, he hears shouts and screams outside but before he can react, he is thrown across the carriage as it flips over onto its side.

Jimin lays there, disoriented from hitting the back of his head against the wood panel, his ears ringing, black circles crowding his vision, his last thought that death had finally come to relieve him from life.

--

Jungkook feels his heart flip at the same time the carriage cart does. Somehow, he knows Jimin is in there and he could get seriously hurt, if not already so.

As Joon and Yoongi deal with the other two alpha hunters not struck by his arrows, Jungkook hops off his horse and rushes over to the upturned cart, heart in his throat.

He hacks off the padlock on the door with one swipe of his sword and then proceeds to rip off the wood piece at it's rusty hinges, eyes falling on Jimin's old cape and his light blonde hair in a heap, unmoving in the back.

Crawling inside, Jungkook hunches over and pulls the small, unconscious form into his arms before making his way back out and into the open air. His heart is pounding with dread, much like when he’d come upon Jimin’s cabin to see the huge bear pawing at his door. This same feeling had encroached upon him and refused to leave until he’d made sure the omega was ok.

He kneels down on the grass and pulls the fur cape away from Jimin's face, relieved at least to see no blood or visible bruises.

"Jimin? Hey, wake up..." he gently taps the soft cheeks. "Jiminie...?"

He breathes easier as he sees a slight fluttering of the long lashes before they open and he is staring into the silver crystalline eyes he'd been afraid he'd never see again.

"Jung-Jungkook?"

He hears the slight whisper and he calms down somewhat.

"There you are...You're ok now, I have you."

--

The three warriors are gathered around their small fire pit that night, Jimin sleeping in the tent under their watchful eyes.

Jungkook gets up every so often to check on the small omega, to make sure he is breathing still, not yet out of the concussion zone.

As he takes off to relieve himself and check again for the 3rd time in this last hour, Joon and Yoongi look at one another.

They've never seen their leader so protective. Earlier, when he'd realized Jimin had been taken, he'd almost ran his horse into the ground to reach the hunters.

They know Jungkook is training to become a leader for their pack and they know he will do just as well, if not better, than his father, but he is usually more private, less emotionally driven.

Until today.

"That was really odd, wasn't it?" Joon finally speaks, pushing back the thick fur hat he has on.

"Yeah."

"He's overprotective of Jimin, almost like Jimin is his mate...which is impossible because of Jimin's condition."

Yoongi sighs and throws the blade of grass he'd been chewing on into the fire.

"I don't think he's attracted to Jimin that way...kind of hard for that to happen without our biological nature and scenting. I mean, face it. We’re a race all about procreativity. Omegas are highly attractive due to their nurturing nature and lushness which turns our minds over to sexual pursuit. I mean, I get it, I wouldn’t expect a scentless omega to be beautiful and lush either, but in the end, he’s still a scentless.” Yoongie leans back onto the log he had been sitting on before continuing.

“We're wolves, scents are the biggest part of our mating rituals and Jimin smells like absolutely nothing so there can’t be a draw there, no link. But it's definitely odd."

Joon nods solemnly. He can't imagine not being able to smell his mate. He can usually tell what her mood is just by whatever scent she releases. Not for the first time, he feels a lot of sympathy for Jimin, a beautiful omega with no scent of his own, no scent to attract a mate, not even a way to smell other wolf’s different, distinct scents.

He thinks Jimin could've been a great mate for Jungkook. As a skilled healer with heart, compassion and beauty as well...they would've been a remarkable team later on in life when Jungkook takes over the pack. He's seen them together quite often this trip, Jungkook always drawn towards the younger's presence. It’s definitely an oddness; Joon has known Jungkook all his life and the younger is not a talkative person. Yet, after being in Jimin’s presence, he guesses he can sort of understand Jungkook - the omega has a gift for bringing out softness in people.

Physically, they were as alpha and omega as any couple could be - Jungkook tall, strong and handsome, Jimin lithe, small and beautiful.

Joon dwells a little on the unfairness of life for many before getting up to go feed his horse.

--

Jungkook can't help the little smile on his face as they near the last hill. Jimin is riding astride with him, dozed off, his head rolling back against his chest, hair brushing his jaw every now and then.

He can’t quite figure out why he is so drawn to Jimin, but he feels an intense amount of protectiveness over the small omega. Maybe it's because Jimin has had to be so strong for so long, depending on only himself...or maybe it's because he's been so mistreated in his pack.

Last night, he had been in a state of worry and concern, probably stressing out his friends as well, checking on Jimin’s condition.

There’s a state of vulnerability to the omega that plays upon his heartstrings, a softness that he hasn’t ever felt with anyone else. From the very first moment, Jimin had never judged him, not even after finding out that he will be a chief in the future. He knows omegas in general are very nurturing and caring, but it goes beyond that with Jimin. He shows compassion and patience and he doesn’t complain, no matter how difficult situations can be. He knows the three have been traveling at a breakneck pace to get home, yet Jimin had not said a word; no matter that he can see the tired lines around the omega’s eyes. Today, he had allowed them to go at a more leisurely pace, now that they were on more familiar grounds.

He tilts his head down and glances at the soft, sleeping features, the round cheeks, small nose and cute chin. Even now, a tender sense of fondness cascades over him and he involuntarily tightens his arms around the omega in a gesture he can’t even fully understand.

Whatever it is, Jungkook knows this protective feeling won't be going away anytime soon. He will keep doting on Jimin like the pseudo little brother he’s become.

He nudges the blonde softly as they hit the rise. He watches closely as his lids flutter open, not wanting to miss the revealing of the pretty silver orbs.

"Jiminie...wake up. We're home."

--

Jimin can't help hiding behind Jungkook's broad back, behind his furry vest, thick jacket and fur cape, as they dismount in the village's central square. He's never seen so many people gather together to welcome their own home. Children start running up to the trio and Jimin watches fondly as the alphas all make sure to pat each child's head as they move along.

Stablemen come out and smile happily at them before taking the horse's tethers and leading them away to get cleaned, fed and put up.

The town is lively with a few wooden cabins and lots of sturdy tents with colorful ropes and tassels as decoration. Jimin is completely charmed, giddy that he may get to call this place his home.

He feels eyes on him, curious ones, and he starts getting antsy, not used to being such public spectacle without announcing his condition.

He suddenly feels a heavy arm slide across his back and pull him forward comfortingly, as if Jungkook can feel his nerves as well.

"Come. We're going to see my parents. They're at my dad's counsel tent."

Jimin almost loses his balance at the announcement but before he can do so, Jungkook is already guiding him into a forest green tasseled tent, the biggest so far, obviously belonging to the chief of the pack.

"Jungkook, welcome back."

Jimin stands off to the side as an older, mustached Jungkook envelopes the younger Jungkook.

The resemblance is too uncanny for it to be anyone other than his father. As they hug one another, Jimin looks around his surroundings, taking in the brightly decorated throws and cloth canvases covering the walls, the plush blankets and seating around the tent. Fancy carved little tables and stools are abound, showing off their wealth and status in a less elaborate ease.

"Jungkook?!"

Jimin watches as the tent flaps open and a small plump lady bustle in, her arms outstretched to hug the alpha warrior.

"Omma," Jungkook leans down and embraces her tightly and Jimin smiles softly. Jungkook catches his eyes and winks.

"Appa. Omma. There is someone you need to meet. He's a healer, an omega, and he has no pack."

Jungkook beckons Jimin over and he follows the order, head bowed, nerves a mess.

"No pack?" he hears the father’s deep voice.

"Appa. This is Park Jimin. He's a scentless omega, shunned by his own pack when young. He's also a healer, just like Seokjin."

Jimin braces himself for the unknown, the expected silent disgust and shame.

He doesn't expect a soft pair of hands to cup his cheeks and lift his face up.

"You're a beautiful omega, aren't you? Don't be shy. Scentless or not, we're all still wolves. We welcome you to our pack. If our son sees good in you, we do as well."

Jimin blinks rapidly as he feels the accumulation of tears well up. He goes for a tremulous smile as he meets the calm, reassuring gaze of the Omega Jeon.

"Omma, he also saved your son." Jungkook offers up cheekily, as if embarrassing Jimin is high on his list of things to further today.

"What?!" the plump omega places a hand over her heart. "Then you are being honored at the feast tonight!"

--

The bonfires and fire pits are lit up, garlands of flowers and leaves are strung about the circle of their town and the villagers are emerging out of their huts and tents in colorful garments, showing off their best for the festivities of the evening.

Not only will this be a welcome home ceremony for the 3 alphas, it also serves as a courting party of sorts, where shy omegas, sweet betas and strong alphas come together to flirt and blush the night away.

Parents will be out with their watchful eyes and cooking skills, ready to offer food to any and all, children will be frolicking around, teasing, taunting, playing with one another.

Jungkook, dressed in gray trousers, a linen peasant tunic with his thick luxurious fur thrown around his back watches the children as they run around the fire pit closest to him, giggling. Seated upon one of the thick logs set up around the area, he gratefully accepts a cup of wine from one of the older women servers and takes a big gulp.

Off to the side, he sees Joon and his mate flirting and Jungkook can't help the smile creasing his face. Those two are such lovesick fools. Married for 3 years, acting still like it'd only been 3 weeks.

His gaze falls on a blonde head exiting his parent's tent and his eyes widen as he takes in Park Jimin, dressed in the pretty, colorful clothing of his pack, a bright smile on his pretty face. A smile that makes Jungkook smile as well.

He continues watching as Jimin bends down and allows one of the little girls to place a white flower crown on his head.

Once again, Jungkook is awash in a sense of relief because Jimin had agreed to come join his pack. The omega is too compassionate a soul, has too giving of a heart to live alone in a dangerous forest. Here, even if he is unable to mate, he will at least have the company of other wolves and their children.

Yoongi's words from before echo through his mind: it's a shame he can't mate...he's damn gorgeous.

It truly is a shame, he thinks as he stares at the way Jimin's face lights up when he laughs, his small hands as he fixes his flower crown, the shy blush on his cheeks as someone teases him.

He sees Jimin look around as if searching for someone before their eyes catch. Jimin offers a little wave, cheeks tinged in pink, his eyes disappearing with a big smile.

Jungkook nods in acknowledgment, glad his mother seems to have taken Jimin under her wing. Good. No way anyone can even attempt to shun Jimin here without offending their leader.

"Stop staring."

Jungkook grins as Yoongi plops down next to him, a goblet of wine in one hand, a chunk of bread in the other.

Yoongi offers the bread hand to Jungkook and he reaches over to break off a hunk before returning his eyes back to the group of omegas.

He sees now that Hoseok, a happy, red haired omega, had approached and befriended Jimin as they walk off arm in arm.

He turns his head and sees his best friend eyeing them as well and he snickers.

He and Yoongi grew up together and even though Jungkook is two years younger, they'd become the best of friends, practically brothers, as they played together and then trained together and now, perform missions together. There is no one Jungkook trusts more than Yoongi, besides Namjoon, who is also one of his closest childhood friends.

"How long are you two going to dance around one another?" Jungkook asks, popping a piece of bread into his mouth.

"Just waiting...want him to make sure he knows what he's getting into if he mates with me."

"Please. The only other person more whipped than you is Hoseok. Stop being idiots, both of you."

"I'll mate when you do. How's that?" Yoongi grins a tipsy, gummy smile at him.

"Don't wait on me, hyung. I'm not even sure I have a mate."

"The seer-"

"He was wrong. We went on this mission and back and the only person we met is a scentless, mateless omega. Should I take that as a sign?"

"Stop. You're usually not so negative. What's up with you tonight?"

"Sorry. Been a long day."

Yoongi offers him more bread as a peace offering and Jungkook takes it with a smile. The friends enjoy each other's company in silence for a moment.

Jungkook looks around again, enjoying the happiness evident in the pack's faces as they flirt and dance and eat.

Fights and disagreements over treaties and territories are plenty and common, but nights like these, when there is contentment in the air...nights like these are Jungkook's favorite. Not for the first time does he wish he had a mate to share it with instead of just friends and family.

"Jungkook-ah, is that who I think it is?"

Jungkook looks up from his wine goblet and into the direction where Yoongi is motioning to.

He sees Hoseok, Jimin...and a tall, broad alpha not a part of their pack.

Indeed he isn't, he is the grandson of their neighboring pack, the Shims.

Jungkook doesn't like how Jimin is smiling up at Shim Wonho. He likes even less how Wonho is holding on to Jimin's hand.

"Why is Shim Wonho here?" Yoongi asks, standing up.

"He and his grandfather are passing by, on their way to a trip out west. They just stopped by to show respect."

Joon's voice comes from behind them.

Jungkook has known Wonho from when they were young. He's never had a reason to dislike the other alpha. But right now, with Jimin's hand in his, Jungkook is finding one.

"Jungkook. Unfist your hand. He's not hurting anyone."

Jungkook releases immediately, not even aware he had been doing so.

Yoongi grins.

But that grin disappears as he sees Wonho lean in and hug Hoseok. His Hoseok.

"That little-"

"Yoongi. Stand down. Hoseok isn't yours." Joon, the voice of reason interjects and a fuming Yoongi stares up at him. Small he may be, but he can be quite a rabid dog when angered.

"Yet." Joon pacifies, causing Jungkook to almost smile. He knows Joon sometimes feels like he's their babysitter or their father.

Wonho looks up, notices them and waves, unaware of the tension on this side of the fire pit.

Jungkook gives a solemn nod back as Joon waves in return and Yoongi...he just continues staring.

They all breathe easier when he moves away from the omegas, called back over to where their horses are tethered.

"I'm going to at least greet him, since you two numb-skulls won't," Joon, ever the patient, ever the intelligent, ever the peacemaker walks off, leaving Jungkook and Yoongi to stare at one another.

--

Jimin is in heaven.

Or as close to it as he can get. it’s been two weeks being a part of the Jeon Pack and he’s never been happier.

Being surrounded by people, children, pets; he's not known how much he's missed with his lonely upbringing.

Most of the Jeon Pack are friendly and attentive, having set him up in his own little tent, next to their other healer, a Kim Seokjin, who is currently on loan to another pack to assist with the birthing of their chief's wife's firstborn.

Knowing that Jungkook is his new chief's son, Jimin tries to stay away, knowing Jungkook has a plethora of way more important duties to attend to then conversing with him.

However, to his shock and pleasant surprise, Jungkook makes it a habit to go out of his way and visit him daily, always to inquire about his settling-in.

Jimin quickly attributes Jungkook's attention to the fact that he is just checking up on his welfare since he is responsible for bringing Jimin into the pack.

Jimin learns from Jungkook that this season, the pack alphas are busy building a cabin for the young children to learn in, a school of sorts, and Jungkook is out with the others everyday cutting wood and carrying it and making sure orders are being carried through.

On one of his many stops at Jimin's tent on his way to his own cabin, he had joined Jimin for dinner and the omega had found out that Jungkook had not had time to eat lunch that day.

To repay the Alpha's attentive kindness, Jimin starts bringing a basket of fruits and berries and whatever meat he has on hand to the construction site. His plan had originally been to just leave the basket with someone there, but of course, Jungkook had spotted him immediately and came down from his perch on the roof beams.

And now, a week later, Jimin is still bringing him lunch.

Today, he has packed a handful of blueberries and some deer meat he'd grilled earlier. The deer meat had been kindly brought to him from Hoseok, who had gone hunting with his beta friends.

Jimin has just rounded the corner shrub when he hears two betas in conversation. He smiles, about to make his presence known when he hears his name.

"...you know that he just feels all kinds of pity for Jimin because he's a scentless omega."

Jimin freezes in his steps.

"I know, Joo-Ah. It just irks me that he doesn't accept snacks from me when I bring him berries, but he eats from Jimin's basket and even visits him."

"Well, Jimin is a very pretty omega, I’ll admit, but he's scentless. Remember that any kind of romance between them is impossible. I think Jungkook just feels sorry for him, thus he's always nice to the omega."

"I know...but still... I wish he would pay attention to me too."

"Hanbi-ah, calm down. You know Jungkook is picky. He's looking for his one true mate and he won't settle til he finds them. Just...leave it alone and stop moping over him. Move on. Shim Wonho couldn't take his eyes off you..."

They move on and Jimin breathes a sigh of relief. He doesn't want anyone to dislike him for any reason. He especially hates having people pity him.

Maybe they are right. Jimin needs to stop being dependent on others.

Turning around, he heads back home, taking his basket with him, deciding that he will distance himself from Jungkook so others won't hate him.

--

"Ok, guys. Go home. We'll play again tomorrow," Jungkook waves off the crew working with him and hops down from the log he was standing on.

His stomach grumbles.

Now that work is done for the day, he has the time to wonder why Jimin hadn't visited with food. Maybe someone in the village was sick and required his ministrations.

Luckily, Namjoon had shared a bit of the meal his beta had packed for him.

Wrapping his fox-haired cape over his shoulder, Jungkook heads out in the direction of Jimin's tent.

Yoongi catches up to him on the path.

"Let me guess. Park Jimin's tent, right?"

Jungkook grunts at his best friend, not in the mood to be teased.

"I didn't see him come by today." Yoongi continues.

"Me neither. Just want to make sure he's ok."

Yoongi is deep in thought for a moment.

"You care an awful lot about that omega."

"That omega has a name, Yoongi."

Jungkook ignores the shit-eating grin Yoongi displays and keeps walking.

"He’s sheltered. Innocent. Sees everything in shades of yellow. I feel responsible for him."

"Hmm."

"Hmm what?"

"He's safe in our pack. There's no real danger or threat around, but you kinda treat him like a baby."

Jungkook stops walking. "A baby?"

"Or...a potential mate." Yoongi gives a nonchalant shrug, biting into his pear.

Jungkook turns to his friend.

"I can't mate with him, Yoongi. He's scentless, he's mateless."

"Ok. Just making sure you know that."

Jungkook shakes his head.

"You know what, I'm tired. I'm heading home to sleep. Good-bye Yoongi."

Yoongi watches as Jungkook skips out on the detour to Jimin's tent and heads up to his own. He feels a bit guilty, as if he had said something he shouldn't have. His curious teasing may have just bit him in the ass. He likes Jimin. The omega is always sweet and nice, even sharing some really great soup with him and Hoseok the other day.

With a last sigh, he follows Jungkook's path towards his own cabin.

--

It's a couple days later and Jimin is really missing Jungkook's presence. He'd seen Jungkook at the morning hunting gathering as the strongest alphas were getting ready to set out on a trip to replenish their meat supply. Jimin had made sure to stay out of the way until the party was leaving before he'd finally looked for Jungkook's departing back.

And all 3 long days they were gone, Jimin had worried for him. Even Hoseokie had teased him a little until the announcement of the return of the hunting party.

As Jimin watches from the back of the crowd, he spots most of everyone still in one piece, a cart of rabbits, a couple deers and a huge bear, their rewards.

Jimin, still shy and not feeling 100% a part of the pack yet, decides to not wait in line while the meat is being cut and distributed amongst the villagers according to hierarchy. With his supplies basket, he instead, starts to approach a couple of the alphas that had been scratched or slightly injured during the hunt.

Jimin has just finished wrapping some herbal paste onto the palm of an alpha, Kang Dongwan, when Hoseok approaches him and tells him to go get in line.

"I'm ok. I still have some rabbits and deer meat from you and Sojung’s generosity last time, Hoseokie." Jimin nods at Kang Dongwan's thank you and turns to look up at his friend. He spots Jungkook beyond, speaking with and handing over a huge chunk of deer thigh to that beta Hanbi. The same one who had been talking about him.

Well, at least those two looked chummy...seems her charms are now working, Jungkook is smiling and laughing with her.

"Aissh, Jiminie! I know you're small, but that isn't going to last you the rest of the week!" Hosek throws his hands on his hips, frowning at his stubborn friend.

"It's ok, hyung, I still have fruits and my vegetable garden is starting to thrive."

Shaking his head, Hoseok gives up and walks back to the center ground as Jimin turns his attention to another alpha with a cut on his eyebrow.

--
Jungkook grins at Hanbi, a beta he's known all his life, as she tells him about the antics of her baby brother spraying water all over their father. He hands her the deer meat as she finishes and sends her off.

He hasn't seen Jimin. He misses the omega's cheery disposition, his soft voice, just his company in general.

He sees a flash of red hair and turns to his left to see Hoseok skipping back towards him. Behind him is Jimin, motioning for a young alpha, Yong Junhyung, to sit down on the log in front of him. He watches as Junhyung says something while Jimin bends over to apply some kind of paste on his forehead. Jimin's face breaks out into a pretty smile and Jungkook feels a flash of irritation slowly crawl up his spine.

He quickly averts his gaze back to the dead animals in front of him. His gaze catches on Yoongi, who is raising an eyebrow at him, as if to let him know he'd seen the exchange. Jungkook chooses to ignore him, turning on a smile for an elder beta as she walks up to him for her share.

--

Jimin pulls his old cape over his shoulders and tucks the cloth covering his basket in securely. The evening chill is setting in and he needs to go get his fire going to warm up his little tent before his fingers get too numb.

As he nears his place, he spots a big bag of something at the entrance to his tent.

His steps slow as he fast approaches, his eyes curiously roving over the brown lump. Placing his basket on the ground, Jimin lifts a corner flap of the cloth around the item and gasps softly.

It's a huge piece of bear meat.

Jimin knows who it's from immediately, as per custom, only the warriors who took down the bear, or the chief's family, gets to partake in the delicacy.

He quickly takes it inside his tent, not wanting to leave it out and give even more cause for tongues to wag.

What does this mean? Jimin paces for a bit, trying to figure out why Jungkook would give him such a coveted piece of food. Especially after they had both been avoiding one another the last couple days...avoiding one another for no reason at all.

Jimin slinks down onto the cushioned pillow on his floor. Absolutely no reason, indeed. They've become friends, why couldn't they continue to be friends? Friends bring each other food and look out for one another, right?

--

"Incoming."

Jungkook looks up from tightening a knot on the log section he is working on when he hears the word come from under Yoongi's breath.

He peers up and sees Hanbi at the top of the little hill, on her way to the building site, a basket of fruits in her hand. He inwardly groans. Her scent of vanilla and lavender wafts past his nose.

She'd come by yesterday as well with the same basket, but Jungkook had managed to avoid her company under the pretense that he had already shared a meal with Namjoon.

He won't be so lucky today, as Hanbi had been smart enough to come before they broke for lunch. Shit.

It's not that he doesn't like her, he just doesn't want to encourage her expectations … expectations that could never come to fruition.

Hanbi is pretty, but he's grown up with her and she's just like a sister to him. She's not his mate, the feelings she may feel for him aren't mutual.

"Ahem. Incoming."

"I heard you the first-"

"No, behind you."

Jungkook turns around and sees Jimin coming up the opposite path, headed in this direction. Jimin is also carrying a basket. The food basket he has become accustomed to and missed seeing.

Not bothering to spare Yoongi another glance, Jungkook jumps down from his perch and starts in Jimin's direction.

Yoongi guffaws loudly after him, knowing it is going to be his duty to turn Hanbi away gently.

--

Jimin had decided that he would bring Jungkook food again today just to see Jungkook's reaction. He did not expect the alpha to practically run up to him, all stinky and sweaty.

"Jungkook? Is everything ok?" he inquires as soon as the other stops in front of him.

"I'm hungry."

Jimin's eyes widen comically before he laughs softly, and bites his lips, completely endeared by the alpha's big doe eyes. He leads the way to an empty log and plops down, handing over the basket to Jungkook as he sits down next to him.

Jimin clasps his hands around his knees and takes a breath.

"Jungkook-ah...listen, thank you for the meat. You shouldn't have-"

"You were busy tending to the wounded so I knew you weren't going to be in line. Thought I'd help you out."

Jimin can't help thinking there's more to it than that, but decides to leave it alone.

He smiles and shakes his head when Jungkook offers him a piece of seasoned deer jerky from the basket.

His smile grows as two children, a brother and sister belonging to alpha Yoon Dujun, approach them.

Jimin watches on fondly as Jungkook looks up and inquires if they’re hungry. Both nod and he offers up the soft berries to the children, laughing when the girl says she wants meat.

Jungkook hands over a piece of meat and Jimin is endeared as he notices that he’d purposefully felt for and broken off the softest, most tender part of the jerky, in consideration of her baby teeth.

The boy is happy with his berries and bids them goodbye before sauntering away with his sister’s hand in his.

Jimin peeks at Jungkook as he eats, knowing that Jungkook’s future mate is going to be one fortunate omega.

--

It's a week later when Jimin comes out of his tent at the break of dawn only to see the village alpha warriors gathering at the center square.

Jimin follows the crowd, wondering what is happening.

"...the witches poisoned the water well causing the children to be sick and have left behind some of their minions in the forest to stall us while they run. Our warriors are fighting, but we are not enough by ourselves as the chief and his grandson are both away with half our warriors."

Jimin catches this last sentence and gasps as he realizes that the alpha warriors from the Jeon pack are suiting up with weapons, preparing to go into battle to help their neighboring pack.

When witches are involved, things are bloody and oftentimes, deadly.

He climbs up on a log to peer over the tall shoulders of the surrounding alphas to see that it is, indeed, a Shim alpha in the middle talking with Jungkook and his father.

Jimin sees that Jungkook is already suited, his sword at his side, his bow and arrows slung over one shoulder, arms crossed, listening intently as the man describes the two witches that came into their town in disguises.

Jungkook barks a few orders and the stablemen hurry to bring out horses. The other pack's village is about half a day's ride out and Jimin knows he has to go too. Hopping off the log, he scrambles over to Jungkook as he prepares to get on his horse.

"Jungkook-ah! I'm coming too!"

Jungkook's eyes widen when he hears Jimin's voice. He turns around quickly, a denial on his lips.

"The children are sick, I'm a healer. Let me do my duty!" Jimin stops right in front of the alpha, reaching out to grab one of his hands.

Jungkook's lips thin out and his brows furrow, aware Jimin is right, but knowing this is not a good idea.

"No, Jimin, later, we can bring the children here-"

"There's no time, Jungkook! Please. Let me help."

"The children may not have the luxury of time to make it back, Jungkook. Jimin's got a point, the other healers can always use another set of skilled hands." Namjoon, on his horse, stops beside them.

With one decisive sigh, Jungkook calls for another horse and helps Jimin on to it.

"You are there for the children and the injured. Do not attempt anything else."

"Yes. I promise."

--

It's the third day, Jimin's back is aching, but he relentlessly works on, making herbal brews to combat tummy issues with the children and creating poultices and patching up wounded warriors.

He's heard that Jungkook is doing well out there fighting, but he won't stop worrying until he can see the man for himself.

That evening, as he hands over a couple of cups of hot tea to the children to quell their ailing tummies from the bad well water, he hears the greatly awaited news that the fight is over, the witches have been caught and destroyed, their minions down as well.

As he changes bandages on a Shim warrior, he keeps his eyes out for Jungkook and his horse.

Jimin has seen Namjoon a few times when he'd come back for supplies, but both Yoongi and Jungkook had stayed out in the field.

Jimin breathes out a sigh and orders the warrior to be careful when bathing before picking up the dirty bandages and heading out back to burn them.

As he drops the bandages into the fire pit, he looks up and his jaw drops as he spots Jungkook, astride his horse, come up the rise, Yoongi and Namjoon flanked on either side.

Everything fades as he sees the trickle of blood on Jungkook's cheek, his one hand wrapped up in a makeshift bandage.

Jimin takes off in a run, eager to make sure there are no other serious injuries on him.

Jungkook has just handed over the reigns of his horse when Jimin's small body slams against him from behind. Jimin see's the surprise on his face as he quickly turns around, his eyes widening when he sees the sparkle of tears in the omega's eyes.

"Hey, hey, don't cry. I'm all in one piece, promise."

"I'm just glad to see you."

--

Jimin wraps the bandage around the cut on Jungkook's palm and knots it quickly, trimming off the excess with a quick rip.

The big alpha is sound asleep, finally, after Jimin had dosed him with a sleeping concoction so he can let his body rest properly.

His eyes fall upon the bigger mark on Jungkook's chest and though it isn't serious, he still worries. He finds himself even wishing Jungkook would hurry and find his mate so that when he gets hurt like this again in the future, they can further aid in rushing the healing process.

Saliva from one's true mate greatly heals a wound, changing the healing process from weeks to mere days.

With one last look at Jungkook, Jimin stands up and stretches. Much as he hates to leave, he, himself, needs some sleep as well.

Their other friends rally around to help them up and move away from the disastrous area, letting them rest and catch their breaths under a few clustered trees on top of piled bedsheets and blankets.

Joon and Yoongi rush off to continue assisting with putting out the last of the flames while a few of the other villagers fawn over Jimin and Jungkook,checking on their injuries.

Jungkook’s twisted ankle is wrapped up by an older beta as decently as possible for the time being and she admonishes him to not move anymore before moving away to assist other injured patients on the other side of the field.

Jimin sniffles and sputters out another cough, taking a deep swig out of the water flask handed to him by a teenage beta assisting the aid before setting it aside and reaching out to his mate, who hasn’t even spared him a glance yet.

“Jungkook…”

“Jimin. What the fuck were you thinking?!”

Jimin’s hand shoots back to his chest, whimpering at the flashing anger in Jungkook’s eyes and the deep growl in his voice, having never heard it before, much less be the recipient of it.

Jungkook instantly regrets his outburst when he sees the tears gather in his omega’s eyes.

“Fuck.” he turns his head away, grounding his ticking jaw, staring out at the open space as he reigns in his temper, an emotion stemmed more from fear than actual anger.

Jimin looks down and curls into himself as he starts to scoot away from his apha, willing his tears to not shed, trying to understand Jungkook’s rage.

But before he can move more than an inch, Jungkook’s hands are on him, pulling him over and onto his lap.

He feels Jungkook’s nose and lips press softly against his temple and he relaxes into the pheromones, holding on to the strong arms encasing him, closing his eyes and letting the tears fall at their will. He’d almost lost his mate. He’s entitled to his tears.

“I’m sorry.”

He hears Jungkook’s soothing voice again.

“I didn’t mean to yell...I just...please understand that my anger is more from fear than anything else. I can’t stop thinking about the fact that you were risking your life for mine, willing to die in there with me.”

“Jungkook-ah,” Jimin looks up, only to have Jungkook hush him with a firm kiss.

“Promise me you won’t do something so foolish ever again. Promise me you’ll heed my words when I know better.”

“I...I’ll try.” Jimin answers with watery eyes.

If Jungkook weren’t so damn scared still, he’d smile at the evasive reply. He knows Jimin’s not the kind to sit by and do nothing. It’s one of the many qualities that he loves most about his mate. This just means he needs to keep a better watch on his omega and his impulsivity.

“Welcome back, alpha.”

He hears the small voice and Jungkook tucks Jimin’s head closer to his heart, reveling in the quiet feeling of being home, being complete.

~ A year later ~

 

Jimin rests up against his mate, listening to the sound of the alpha’s heartbeat. Jungkook is reclining against an old oak tree, Jimin between his open legs, back against his chest as they enjoy one another’s presence and watch the activities of the villagers down yonder.

The skies are lit up with firecrackers, celebrating the Jeon Chief’s 60th birthday and the completion of the school building.

It’s nearing the end of the festivities, the chief and his wife have already retired, the older villagers scattering to go home, tired from the dancing and full from the boars that were served at the feast tonight.

“I used to wonder if I was ever going to have a mate to hold on occasions like this.”

Jimin smiles tenderly at the words, voiced out in a quiet, husky tone. He turns his face and lands a kiss on the strong arm braced over his shoulder.

“I couldn’t even think of a mate,” he murmurs back.

Jungkook plants a kiss on the crown of Jimin’s head.

“Well, now you have one to annoy you for all eternity.”

Jimin laughs loudly, reaching up to smack Jungkook’s forearm.

“Your mom came by earlier when you were out. She dropped off more baby blankets she’d knitted.”

Jungkook laughs, his hand moving to smooth over the small, taut roundness of Jimin’s belly, where their pup is barely blooming.

“Omma’s ecstatic but you should’ve seen Appa during the council meeting yesterday. He took such pride in announcing that he is going to be a grandfather soon, it embarrassed the hell out of me.”

Jimin giggles, his small hand coming to cover over Jungkook’s as they continue to dally in the peaceful night air, each one wondering how to make the other happier.

“I love you,” Jimin says softly, suddenly feeling overwhelmed by all his emotions.

“I love you, too.”

He hears Jungkook’s reply and it eases him greatly. Never in a million years would Jimin ever think he would be where he is now, with who he is with, loved, thoroughly, completely.

“Look.”

Jimin looks up at Jungkook as he cants his head towards the left of their view. He turns his gaze curiously.

Jimin gasps as he sees, in the shadows, Jung Hoseok and Min Yoongi together. Kissing.

“Oh my god. Does this mean…?”

“Finally. Yoongi used to joke with me that he’ll mate when I do. I think it’s safe for him now.”

Jimin giggles, elated that his friend is getting the happiness he’s so deserving of. They can finally stop driving everyone nuts with their dancing and prancing around one another and can finally bicker and tease each other like an old, married couple in the privacy of their own home instead of out in an open field.

It seems, happily ever afters were not strictly for children’s fairytales only after all.
